uDRnfPaCpoIUGYn5x9PWOw.text: Good service, good food thats the power of mannas  The food is really good and the service is awesome. Honeslty i reconmend this place to anyone

I4kdC7AZw8sMI5X-WHivfw.text: Manna is a great ayce kbbq restaurant. The staff does a great job delivering the food in a timely manner. Also, the meat quality is great and always ready to eat.  The hostess, Scarlett, does a great job providing a table and assisting us if needed. She has a positive attitude and enjoys working here to her full potential.   My only concern is why japchae is on the menu, but is only served as a side dish. I had the impression that it would be a family sized serving.  I recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants to try kbbq for the first time. The staff has no issues with helping customers who have never been before.

vr_X4EFzyf2q-Z5GFkbvXw.text: It was way overpriced with subpar service.  Staff seemed annoyed when you had to ask for items which makes no sense because it's setup for you to rely on the staff for your entire meal.

_64lsvxdo8Cp4mkiM3cu2g.text: As a self proclaimed Korean bbq connoisseur, I've always been slightly skeptical of all you can eat kbbq spots, but this place did not disappoint. Quality meats quickly provided in large quantities for an affordable price--how can you beat that?? Come with an appetite! My favorites are the Geutsal (boneless short rib) and the Chadol Baegi (black angus beef brisket). That's on their more premium menu for $28.99 a person.  Make sure you ask for the sesame oil to dip your meats, it goes perfectly with these. If you're a vegetarian, like my wife they charge you less ($11) for whatever veggie dishes you want, which was a nice perk. Her faves were the Soondubu (tofu stew) and the Japchae (glass noodles). Service was great. You can order three meats at a time for the table. The waiters were very attentive and quick to  take additional orders. We didn't even realize there was a button to press to call them back because we never needed it. Have already taken friends back and will continue to do so! Five stars for the best bang for your buck AYCE in town.

_P97q084-hRe-dNI3Jq2bQ.text: Texture of meat well thought of at this place.  Along with the flavors.  Mango ice cream is outstanding.  Special dinner cooking the food at my pace that I want to eat it.  Great Job Guys. Will be back.  Try the beef tongue and cheek it will surprise you.

HF8qe0oSMObkIilmg_SUQA.text: Actually very good place. They give pretty generous servings so I'd recommend ordering 1-2 meats at a time. Pretty high quality stuff here for a great price. Highly recommend

rFd7B1TnfJSc0bx2c-Bjpg.text: First time trying Manna after it being highly recommended by friends! Amazing and delicious! Great portion sizes and great service! Sharon was on top of it all night! Best service we've had anywhere in a while!

_P2oMm6LLVwz157XFe-0kg.text: 5 Stars for food. 5 Stars for service.  1 Star for being turned away at 8:30 PM because "kitchen is already closed" and even though all information on google and yelp and their front door say they close at 10PM and we made an hour drive to get there.  1 Star for being told when we went at 9 PM, we only had the option to order one time even though it's AYCE because their kitchens were closing. vg5orLMg8rDj71MpsrQi8g.text: Manna is probably the best korean bbq place here in AZ.  They have good soups and their meat quality is way above Gen's in Tempe market place. p0MkdfQ7xBontnQVdKJiMg.text: Great lunch spot... went here today for work with customers.  Great service, great food.  Waitress was from Korea and talked about her culture and experiences coming to America.  Gave great recommendations on food.  Will definitely be back.

jFQ26qP-okKIWWzG_FvYiA.text: Went in today looking for a new experience and came out very dissatisfied.   When I first came in I was made to wait several minutes before anybody even greeted me, not because they were busy mind you there was only two other customers  at the time but the two waitresses and the whole staff were all in the back room.  This place is higher in price than all other all-you-can-eat places. Was told the reason was for higher-quality  cuts of beef, and that would be understandable, however when I ordered, I found that they limit the cut to just one per person! I found a lot of things missing or they had ran out of. For instance, when I asked for glass noodles the answer was "she hasn't made any today." When I asked for veggies but asked to hold the onions I was told onions and zucchini was the only veggies they had despite showing six or more on the menu. ( remember the whole reason you are paying more supposedly is because of the bigger number of choices, LOL). I was also put off by the fact that they only sell canned soda for $2 ,they do not have any Fountain drinks.  Lastly the bathroom was horrible, they supposedly sent someone to clean it before I will use it and it seems like all they did was run a wet mop literally over everything the toilet was dripping wet when I went to use the facility.

RP5XLoWJmsVOdNMyNQ2WjA.text: I'll be honest that I went here despite of being absolutely sick of eating korean bbq. I go once or twice a week to Gens and I gotta say I'm tired of it. Once this place opened and my brother insisted of trying it, I went along with for lunch and I'll be honest, it's very good! Walking in, the atmosphere is nice and clean. If anyone has been to the California location in San Marcos,this is the same one! With the banchan being typical, they have cilantro and onions in a sweet, sour and spicy sauce that was amazing. The meat quality here is great, and I will have to say, almost better. Thick cut galbi and a 12oz steak was amazing. It was tender and full of flavor. They also have unlimited steamed egg so that's basically life right there. The brisket portion was huge, like I'm talkin you can feed 6 people with that. The portions here are plentiful. With 2 people coming in ready to eat I was overwhelmed with the thick cut, and large proportioned meat. This is probably gonna be my next visited kbbq spot once I get back from my hiatus of kbbq. The owner is a friendly guy and I talked to working with him in the future. The service not to mention was also very friendly. I'm glad to once again put aside my korean bbq overload to try this place.

TPHtS6XF2ftPsnxy4r5MrQ.text: Nope. Can't do it.  For starters, they don't have the rice paper.  The girl said there was a substitute for it and brought me pickled daikon.  Yeah...that was NOTHING similar to rice paper.  For one, it was pickled and another it's crunchy! That's a game changer for me.  The food was flavorless.  They ran out of a bunch of food which is annoying considering you're paying for AYCE but in this case it was AYCE when it's available.  I remember going to Manna back when we were in California and it was pretty good....here in Arizona it definitely isn't the same.  The seats and tables were sticky.  They stack their sauces on top of each other which I think is unsanitary as the bottom of the dish is now touching the sauce that I will be dipping my food into.  I just didn't feel clean being in there.  I'm sorry, Manna...I really wanted to like you because we need AYCE KBBQ here, but this one is off my list.

xvE0HfID2gvplOFzanLj_w.text: Korean BBQ isn't at the top of my list. But, their menu looked really interesting. I don't really enjoy paying to then do all of the cooking.  That said, Manna does a really good job. The place is clean, including the restroom. The people are friendly.   The A1 menu is the way to go. I mean really. It's only a few $ more and you get the better cuts of meat. The portions are generous. And, even thought the "all you can eat" is limited to dine in (no taking leftovers without paying more) and for no longer than 2 hours, you'll get good value.  The rib eye is really good and easy to cook. The beef short ribs had great flavor. The spicy pork ribs weren't really spicy. They were good but hard to cook. The beef bulgogi had a wonderful flavor. I didn't like the brisket because it was about 50% fat. It's cut as thin as thin-sliced bacon. The shrimp were hard to deal with and too much work for the size. The egg was straight up weird and tasted like what air would taste like if it were an egg. For my taste, all of the meats except the rib eye had excessive amounts of fat still attached.  Refill service was lacking. The "hot" tea was more like "warm" tea. They had a sign upon entry advising they were out of the large intestine. Oh darn. I nearly turned on my heels. Kidding! The menus have items lined out rather than reprinting them - makes me think "this place is authentic." Why waste perfectly good printed menus, right?  If you're into this kind of dining, I believe you'll be very happy with your experience here.

FZv9sAKFXYN_wl1g2O6nTg.text: Compared to Gen:  The wait is much shorter the meat quality is definitely better the service is much quicker the banchan is more extensive their tofu soup is much tastier.   Their A1 premium menu is $3 more than the dinner price at Gen but it is definitely worth it. The experience is top notch and meals are always consistent.  Props to Alex for being a great waiter.

iYDKhxSFJOBkdE-dgH7F9Q.text: Korean BBQ spots are popping up all over the valley and I'm all about sampling the goods to find which ones work. The location is probably the best thing for me as it's conveniently located for dinner or lunch with my coworkers. If you do have to deal with a wait, you can slide over next door to the market to look around and pick up a few things.   The selection of food has some variations towards some of the other spots and the menu is broken down into 2 price categories (A1 Premium which is around $29/person & the A2 @ $21/person). I have to admit that I struggle to pronounce a lot of things so I pointed out which numbers I wanted on the menu to make sure. When the food came out, we all were looking trying to figure out what it was as it didn't match our order. My kiddos were hungry and said whatever... When we were ready to order again, the 1st thing requested was Shrimp and that's when I realized someone "assumed" the wrong thing. That's probably where the low star rating comes... service... Granted their were plenty of people that night, but while I was pointing to the menu, our server just assumed we were ordering from the lower priced menu. She was quick to point it out and I was even quicker to give her "AND YOUR POINT IS WHAT" response and look. We like baby octopus, we like shrimp, we like Goutal... hence why I pointed to that list. When the shrimp and the other items we requested came out, we go a double order for the stuff we initially ordered.. Not sure how we were gonna good it all but we figured it out.   After that, everything went pretty smooth for the night and then we wrapped up. The place has another room in the rear with 2 TV's and is excellent for groups and celebrations. Each time I've gone I've been in that back area. If you're big on soft drinks you will only get a can as it's not all you can drink beverages... I typically drink water but wanted a  sprite or coke on standby over the rocks at some point.

Gmmz1if3hstLflLbc91J-A.text: Go to AYCE (all you can eat) KBBQ! I was so excited when this place opened. Coming from LA, AYCE Kbbq places are everywhere and I'm so happy AZ is finally opening up a lot of these places. The meat quality is pretty good for all you can eat! We usually order the brisket and beef belly. The japchae and soon du bu is a must when we come here as well!  However, BEWARE of the wait. One time we came on a Saturday evening and the wait was an hour and a half. I believe they start getting busy around 7pm since we came here on a Friday evening at 6pm and didn't wait for a table. When we were leaving there was a wait and a lot of people in their waiting area.  MANNA ALL THE WAY!!!

CVqwPPFr1FffEPjUggMVXA.text: Food: really delicious with good quality of meet  However, for me it's a bothersome to cook by yourself ( which's the idea of the Korean cuisine to cook your own food) and I'm not a good cooker too so there was a struggle. I mean sometimes you go to restaurants just to avoid cooking lol.  Price: it's fair not cheap but also not expensive.  Place: it's cozy and clean.  Staff: we faced problem with our waitress at first because she was Asian and don't speak English, then they brought us an American waiter, but all are polite.  The place worth trying at least once in your life

GSpVREnP92qfHX1bc0VCYQ.text: Tonight, my husband and I decided to try out Korean BBQ for the first time, so we visited Manna BBQ. We both had the same assessment: a lot of work that really wasn't worth it. But hey, we tried something new.   First of all, you should not eat Korean BBQ if you are pregnant or have a compromised immune system (seriously). There are some extremely unsanitary practices that are bound to happen in this type of set-up. For example, since we had never eaten Korean BBQ before, we decided to try out the all-you-can-eat option, so we could sample a lot of different meat. One of the things we tried was the shrimp. The dish came to the table and all the shrimp still had their heads attached. Because we were virgins, our server took pity on us, and tried to help us out. For sanitary purposes, we had been waiting to cut the meat up with the table scissors until after the meat was fully cooked. Our server didn't seem to be aware of safe meat handling practices because she proceeded to take the scissors and cut all the heads off the shrimp when they were still raw. She then took our cooked meat off the cooker and cut it up, using the same scissors she cut the raw shrimp with. I thought my husband was going to turn green. It should also be noted that the shrimp is definitely a meat to avoid here. It was very poor quality. It was soft to the touch (not firm) and it was impossible to peel the shell off the shrimp, causing most of the meat to be wasted.  Another unpleasant sight was when our cook top was charred, they came to swap it out. Underneath the cooking surface was at least five inches of grease; it was pretty gross. We both guessed the grease was not cleaned out on a nightly basis.  Additionally, my husband complained that his side of the table wasn't clean. It was covered in some kind of sticky substance and he ended up with some kind of gunk on his arm.   Both my husband and I had a hard time telling the difference between all the red meats because they were so heavily seasoned. My husband did like the pork belly, but I didn't think it was anything special. I would not order the baby octopus. It's not that the octopus was bad, it's just that it was too difficult to figure out how long to cook it for. Which brings me to my next issue: YOU are the cook. If you do not know how to properly cook meat at home, you're going to waste a lot of money screwing up meat here. It's easy to under and/or over-cook the meat, if you are inexperienced or just a bad cook.   This is also a terrible place for a first date. The cooktop exhaust fans that are at each table are loud, the tables are wide, and you really have to pay attention to cooking the meat, so it's hard to relax and have an involved conversation. I also would not bring a child under 8 here; they could easily burn a finger on the cooktop, if they aren't constantly monitored.  Each order comes with salad and rice, along with six sides: kimchi, pickles, pickled radishes, fish cakes, bean sprouts and "sweet" mashed potatoes. The kimchi, pickles, and pickled radishes are delicious and I hate radishes! The fish cakes are also excellent. The mashed potatoes are good if you eat them with the meat. They are sweet because they add corn to them, which is a nice contrast to the salty meat.  We both thought the service was great! Our server was very attentive, kind, and helpful. Our table was constantly bussed and the hostess was very sweet. She got us a few things we needed, when our server wasn't available.  Two final notes: you cannot take home leftovers and they do not accept Discover.  In the end, we both decided we would not be returning, but it's really not because we had a bad experience. I think it's just because we aren't Korean BBQ people.

OUGWPhbfrd5ZoID6IYtIPg.text: There was one couple ahead of me. I waited about 15 minutes to be seated. When I finally was, they showed me - - eating by myself - - to a table for six people, in a wide open area. I said is this the only table you have? They said yes. I said never mind. un5G1TlqXbOGMykAqo7rdw.text: This is based on service and their yelp page before even getting a chance to try the food... we joined the waitlist for 8:45 checkin and we were driving from Scottsdale to Mesa to try this place. eIpj6tKjQEdKm29kctR6cQ.text: Pricing:  Great KBBQ! For $21.99 (or $27.99 for the premium). Definitely go for the A1, Cause I like beef tongue.  Probably my go to KBBQ, because price is reasonable. Meat is fresh and good. I prefer their marinated galbi.   Also, No long wait for a table Vs. Gen BBQ!!! Kind of hidden location next to the supermarket.   Been here 2 times already.  Pretty consistent with service and quality of food.  I do recommend coming in a group of at least 4, as always a bigger group means you will be able to try all or most of the meats, and you will be able to finish the meats, so you don't get charge for over ordering.  Food: good selection of meats for kbbq. Has all your basic types. Galbi, bulgogi, LA galbi*, beef tongue*, brisket*.  * = i like Get tongs for everyone to use and cook. Make sure to control the temp as you cook.   yes to: Japchae, steam egg, and salad for fiber  Service: Friendly and pretty fast. tip: Use the wall button to get flag down a waiter or waitress   Parking: nice big plaza outside the supermarket plaza  Come check this place out.

2eGvYyg7ycZorXKoAisQ-Q.text: Manna BBQ is the best Korean bbq in AZ. You don't need to read anymore, just go eat here.   Alright, if you're still reading, Manna's got the best quality meat--you can see how marbled the meat is in their cuts, and you can definitely taste the flavor. If they only had beef belly and brisket I'd be completely fine--that's how good it is. Their sides are better than the other places, not only in taste but also selection--they have fried egg!   The restaurant is a little small, and they're usually pretty busy, but if you've got a group of 6 or more you can call ahead and make a reservation! Otherwise you'll just be waiting for your name to be called.   The service is solid here--they let you choose 3 meats at a time, and they're pretty lenient if you wanna choose 1 or 2 more.   You can't go wrong with Manna.

FJ7rFTbjUGwT25lMtkiVhw.text: Manna BBQ is an all you can eat Korean barbecue restaurant with a very simple menu: A1, which includes the premium options, and A2, although not premium, still offers a lot of great options.   I came here with a group of 8, and there was plenty of food to go around! If this is your first time trying Korean BBQ, I suggest starting with the classics: bulgogi beef, galbi, brisket, and pork belly.  The quality of food here is better than most Korean BBQ locations around the valley, and the service was great! They offered suggestions on things to get when we didn't know what we wanted, which is a plus.   If you're looking for a new and interactive experience while you eat, Manna BBQ is the place for you!

hk3OhuOGbez3SEQ7u-FYdA.text: Loved this place! Was craving Korean bbq without a weird clubby atmosphere. Had only ever been to Gen and while good, it isn't really my scene. Looked around for another place and saw this was down the street from me. Super prompt and friendly servers. It's all you can eat with set price, you get charged extra for crazy left overs so make sure you order what you can eat! Chadol is my all time favorite, but everything looked amazing. Had the potstickers for an appetizer and they were great too. It's part of the Asiana plaza so check it out!

AbvRaJS_3T5Lj4yoLo1_sQ.text: You get what you pay for with this Korean BBQ... I went during lunch and got the 17.99 per person lunch special and they had tons of options. Also the side dishes are amazing and the staff is wonderful and helpful if it's your first time trying KBBQ. 10/10 would reccomend for anyone that has never tried it but wants to.

photos.caption: Photo of Manna BBQ - Mesa, AZ, United States

YRig4Gxd3ZVdgBfPHtGQkQ.text: Great place for AYSE! My dad loves this place and I can see why. The option for Rib eye was surprising but worthy for a KBBQ spot sadly this item is limited to one per table per visit. The beef tongue and pork jowl were exquisite options you don't see very often. The bonchon options were good minus the option for gochujang. Go early because they can get busy. But don't take my word for it, Try it out!

6EvWYIRPZ1RGH0DOJFHNyw.text: Seated right away. Service was a little slow. And I didn't like that they didn't change out the grill plate during our time there. Overall the food was great and the experience was overall still a good one.

IPrD-pRU-C5OD2EpVcmZ2Q.text: This trip to Manna BBQ features a group of 8 friends, 6 who had never had KBBQ prior. Once everyone got there we were hanging out in the back room. Some of the uninitiated were voicing confusion about what to order. After assuring them that they would have a good time we grabbed some brisket, bulgogi beef and pork belly for both halves of the table.   Once the group understood the process, the night was a blast. The Bulgogi beef and chicken were crowd favorites and everyone was eager to cook meat for themselves.   The quality of the meat seemed very fresh! Now, I'm not an expert on meat, but it looked, tasted, and smelled great. My tip for the brisket is to be generous with the meat sauce. Since the cuts aren't marinated the result can be a little dry. But a quick dip in the sauce remedies this.   For the dinner price, everyone left feeling full. Our group went through two rounds of finishing everything in addition to some cups of rice before throwing in the towel. I would definitely come here again with more friends since the tables can handle 4 individuals.   Lastly, the friends who had never tried KBBQ before wanted me to mention that they also recommend this place. Their enthusiasm was explosive.

76ZlP0uRoyiI29XlkWqHIg.text: Great service and meat quality. My mom and her friends loved it. I felt like I was in ktown in LA. Very good

YdTO_CE1-U06vshX2xf7NA.text: Just finished our meal, first timers.  We drove here from north Phoenix, glad we did.   Great food and wonderful service, very attentive.  Definitely recommend this place.

H5Eg8lWO5j94WBhCnSmlCw.text: This was the first time I had ever ate Korean bbq and Manna did not disappoint! The restaurant is very clean and the staff works quickly. Our server, Sharon was amazing! She happily answered all of our questions. My husband has a mild peanut allergy and she was wonderful checking on ingredients for us. We will definitely be back for the wonderful food but Sharon's knowledge and kindness is what stuck out the most!

RPGyRStN6P3V8JCFHKPfDA.text: This place has such terrible service! Our waitress was so rude. First she took our order but cut us off and walked away. She also kept repeatly ignoring our table and walking away when we were trying to order more. Not only that when she she was setting food for our table, she dumped all three of the plates of bulgogi on the grill. I don't mind that she tried to be nice by putting our food on there, but it didn't allow any other meat to be on the grill. We had intestines and pork belly and those usually cook longer. Also because she dumped all of it in, it left some juices and when we put our other meat in it tasted like bulgogi. Our waitress also kept dismissing us when we politely called her over. However despite the bad service the food was absolutely delicious. The meat were so tender and soft, it just melted in my mouth. Their green tea was also spectacular!  I love how everything tasted I just wish the service was a little better. I might come back just for the food! Overall the service is lacking but the food is super yummy and I would come again.

nyOc5bUDIR4MUj0pIcCatw.text: Nothing could prepare us for the truly BEST Korean BBQ we have ever had. Dish after dish of fresh cabbage, seaweed salad, cucumber salad, and kim chi. And then plate after luscious plate of beef, pork belly, steak, baby octopus, teriyaki, and more. Our party of six had our fill and then some. The flavor on the meat was terrific - so fresh and flavorful. The service here is spot on - so attentive and gracious. Can't wait to re-visit again!!!

EJspgUt2P_ml5IReIOCyAg.text: Quick service and large serving! Also good price. I love their beef bulgogi and chicken bulgogi. The marinating sauce was so tasty. I also like the steam egg and daikon wrap. We enjoy several types of meat and octopus.

ugcp9oMEN6dyp8K0mY88Pw.text: First time eating at a Korean BBQ, and I don't think I want to go anywhere else. My roommate took me here with him. For $30 you get all you can eat meat. The beef tongue was better than I thought (never had tongue of any kind) and the brisket was amazing. I don't know what the two sauces were but one was sweet and the other salty, both added so much flavor to the food. This place knows their meats.  I got to practice my Korean a little too so I can't wait to practice more. The service was fun and very attentive. Will definitely come here whenever I can.    !    ! !

pbQagsOrm3ziwF8iCI7a_w.text: I came to celebrate my birthday at Manna Korean barbecue and it was very very delicious Song our server was very entertaining polite and very informative of each dish we had. She is super authentic! Great music very clean! And by the way the rice wine is amazing!!!! Definitely will come back!!!!

Fz6p_RMk182sBMh2Rg_fCw.text: Went to Manna for dinner and was blown away by their outstanding service and great selection of Korean dishes. Our hostess Shannon was very welcoming and took the time explaining why they're different from other Korean BBQ restaurants. She stated, they take pride on customer service, serve high quality meat and properly marinate them. My dinner experience, exceeded my expectation. I left happy, full and ready to come back next week.If you're in the area then this a must try!

l0hDWtPR5Hxnwa4XeaSMSw.text: The service was great. The location clean and we went right before rush hour so we got to enjoy a bit of silence.   The food was great . I wish their veggies selection was better , tho.   The price was fair.

PksPA8oJyoTDaizMFq3Pgg.text: First time trying AYCE Korean BBQ. Yes there is a wait but it's worth it! The meats were well marinated and tasted good. Sides were good. Just wish service was better. I know they're on the new side. But we had to order everything twice before we got it. One server wrote things down and that helped more than the one that tried to remember.

jGxGZSDQZKpljmJBVqaZhg.text: After looking around Phoenix for the best Korean bbq experience, here is the winner. The place is clean, the staff friendly and the food quality excellent. It is also cheaper than other Korean barbecue places such as Sizzle.

ldhJh6quF7cVOVxfwHKBJg.text: For a first timer to this type of Korean BBQ I was enamored. The restaurant is set up very cozy. My waitress was warm and friendly and got me setup on how things worked. The accompanying dishes were great (I loved the glass noodles and the cilantro salad) it was a great dining experience and I will definitely be back

_7U83E7765P73I8iL7kLvQ.text: A decent all you can eat Korean BBQ. A nice alternative to Gen which is almost always packed. Service was a bit slow. I think if they had been more timely on getting the food out they could have turned their tables over faster. It took about 15 to 20 minutes for us to get our check, for example. We were there on a Saturday night so being busy was understandable but I would expect that they would want to get us out as soon as possible in order to seat someone else at the table.  They offer a option A and option B to their menu. Option A has more items available than Option B. Not everything on the menu was good. The basics were good like the bulgogi and kalbi. The sirloin was tough. They have a nice table setup with the exhaust fans. The kimchi selection was great. Soda is by the can and not from a fountain dispenser.

2jEKpS_7_3WmkgzBH5ESNw.text: Cameron was very helpful! The food was great and the servings were large. We'll be back again!

BWmCQifeHmfnuQ-uIgxmMQ.text: Oh my God! This is the best way barbecue have ever been to. I'm going to fly back to Mesa just so that way I can enjoy this delicious food.  I highly recommend the bulgogi, the spicy chicken, the brisket. Heck. Get anything you want. It's amazing. Just come here and wait till your hearts content!

2lHf8faOsHMz0_tLM0UMDw.text: Food is excellent. Service is excellent. Lots of good side dishes  Price range is okay. Tons of free parking.

VAj1faU-rRrGoePr21vXjA.text: Had their $22 all you can eat bbq.  The meat was good and I'll def be back.  The seating was a bit tight and packed for my liking.  But there were tons of people and the service was good.  I don't think you'll be disappointed.   The first top five meat offerings were all great.

lxi1iy8HRveS9TJi_2rNBg.text: It was really good!  I recently visited Arizona and my boyfriend and I were craving Korean BBQ. Being from Dallas, we are spoiled with multiple joints and we were hesitant to try a KBBQ place in Phoenix as there were only about... 3, 2 of them being AYCE. However, we gave it a shot and I'm glad we did.  The menu selection was broad and we were very happy with everything we chose. I recommend starting out with the non marinated items (brisket, beef belly, pork belly) and then ease in the marinated meats. Our favorite was the Galbi. Although they do have short rib, they are deboned so we were sad about that. But everything was marinated well and the dipping sauces & banchan were yummy! I also recommend getting the steamed egg, tofu soup, and corn cheese. Don't forget to ask for garlic and peppers to flavor your meat!   The ventilation and grills here were great! Unlike the Manna here in DFW, the air vent was the one where you pull down closer to the grill. Our food also cooked very fast and the servers were quick to adjust the heat/change the grill whenever necessary.  Overall, the experience was wonderful and it was nice that there is a Tours next door for some dessert.

gEe13LKaMQZYHRfZee7rXQ.text: Came in here on a Friday night after work with a large group (about 15 people) - they do take reservations. We were able to get two tables that seat 8 right next to each other, located in their back room. Each table had 2 grills. It may have been the location we were in (because the booths in the dining room were much larger) but the space was VERY tight. This is especially difficult when you are trying to cook and share food.   We ordered a bunch of different meats and the brisket was my favorite. Our grill kept burning and it would take a while to get them to replace it. The issue was, being in the back room with a burning grill, the ventilation was awful! I ended up coughing a bit and leaving my group earlier than planned due to not being able to handle the smoke.   Overall, the food was decent and the rest of the service was pretty quick (except for when I asked for my check).

xqDIcbe3G5EYfxzbw9UrxQ.text: The food was fantastic! It was our first time there. We ordered the galpi and bulgogi meat and they were so good! Definitely recommend. Even their appetizers and sides were delicious! The place is well ventilated. It's in a great location right next to a Korean bakery and market. The service is great! Everyone was very nice.   Very packed on the weekend, so make sure to put your name on the waiting list on yelp.

rBmS0Q-dFM3NWB-eNHWhjg.text: Ehhhhh I was not terribly impressed with manna.... The good includes their prices are lower than some other Korean BBQ places in the area and some of the meats were very tasty. The bad was mostly service related. My friend had never had Korean BBQ before and therefore tried some meats she didn't like. I didn't like those either, so they went uneaten. The restaurant wanted to charge us for any excess meat we didn't consume..... I feel like this goes against the point of an all you can eat restaurant, which, to me, is to be able to try new things without the risk of cost. I also feel that the portions of meat they brought out were huge, and, if they wanted to reduce waste, they should offer smaller tasting portions. Anyway, it wasn't terrible if you know what you're getting into, but it was a bit of a frustrating experience for us.

pBrVkNEF0Seo6SnMelENaA.text: I looooove all you can eat Korean BBQ, especially the sluggishness you feel when the meal is over, you've consumed 10 pounds of meat, and the meat sweats begin. That's how you know you did it right.   FOOD: Manna did not disappoint! All the meat was super flavorful. For extra seasoning, they serve salt and pepper, some type of sauce that pairs well with meat, and chili paste (you have to ask for this if you want something spicy). My personal favorite meats were the bulgogi, chadol (beef brisket), and of course the pork belly. If you're on the adventurous side, I would highly recommend the cow tongue. It doesn't sound appetizing but it's thinly sliced and cooks quickly, culminating in a juicy and tender bite. I was initially hesitant to try it but I was inspired by a quote from the legendary Charles P. Thompson: "the secret to success is walking through each door that opens to you". I was glad I listened to that advice!  I have never enjoyed chicken at KBBQ restaurants, but the chicken bulgogi here was actually really good. It's not in the same tier as the beef and pork dishes. They also have some side dishes included in the AYCE that are cooked in the kitchen - we had fried chicken, gyoza, and a steamed egg dish. The chicken and gyoza were great and helped break up the meat marathon! I personally would not recommend the steamed egg because I thought it tasted like an unseasoned omelette.   SERVICE: I did not think the service was amazing at filling up side dishes or water cups, but I did not have any complaints. This place was BUSY, so the fact that we were getting food brought out quickly was impressive. There were a few times where I was waiting for a water refill but I do not think it was enough to warrant docking a star.  Overall, I liked this joint a little more than GEN in Tempe Marketplace. I thought the meat was better here and I enjoyed the vibe more. The vents for the grills are also retractable at Manna, which really helped avoid some smoke when our grill started to char.   LASTING TIPS: - Use the Yelp Waitlist feature to put your name in early, since it can get pretty busy - Best if you come with a large group of people so you have room to try everything. We had 6 people and we were able to try just about all the meats on the menu. I've been to other places where it was just my GF and I and it was much harder to finish everything  - Designate one of your party as the official grill-master. It can be overwhelming to manage the grill and make sure not to cross-contaminate anything with raw meat - Relish in the meat burps the day after your meal

Photo of Manna BBQ - Mesa, AZ, United States. Firing up that grill!
Photo of Manna BBQ - Mesa, AZ, United States. Yum

bBaBKhlkHjUO8JXZbCH0ug.text: I've been meaning to try out another kbbq place and I had heard good things about Manna. Once you get there, you put your name on the waitlist on an iPad and they'll text you when there's a table available. I didn't realize they had this system beforehand, so there were about 3 parties before me when I got there. Alternatively, you can put your party on the waitlist through Yelp. Super helpful if you know you're about 15 min away and there is a 15 min wait - means you don't need to wait long after arriving.  We ended up adding 2 more people to our party after putting ourselves on the waitlist. No worries, because we informed the server of this update before our table was ready and she was able to find a table to fit all of us. We ordered soo many meats and dishes, I don't even remember what we all ordered. I just know that it was all SO good and I ate SO much. Some of my favorites were the galbi, bulgolgi, and chadol. For appetizers, we also got the gyoza, corn cheese, fried chicken, and steamed egg. I thought these were alright to try and to give myself a break from the meat, but the meats are definitely the star of the show. I really enjoyed the banchan, and we got like 3 refills.  The only thing was that it took a while to find someone to get water refills. But I understand because they were pretty busy. They were really good about switching out the grill when it got burnt though! Even though we had a relatively large party of 6, the wait wasn't bad at all for a Friday night dinner (~15 min).  I would definitely come back here. They have so many meat options and so many of them were really good. I feel like with some other places, they only have a few that are really good and the others are just alright. I came straight from a happy hour to this so needless to say, I left very full. It was so good though that I ate more than I normally would have. I would recommend coming with a group of friends because you can try a larger variety of meats/dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Manna BBQ - Mesa, AZ, United States. Grilling action shot

SD_qJ4ryAvGbsVWfg0auYw.text: Very overrated. MSG apocalypse. Pessimistically full empty cup of water  I like Gen's better first of all. Despite people complimented how savory the food is, there are only 2 dips: soy sauce, salt and pepper. At Gen's there are more dipping sauces. The food is alright. They were filled with MSG. I was so thirsty. The soybean paste soup contains high level of salt. I couldn't finish 5 spoons of it.   I felt left out by the waiter. No one ever refilled my water after several times walking past two empty cups (one was my father's). We literally had the cups placed at the end of the table so their hawk's eyes could see. Nope. I didn't know if my table was assigned a specific server or not because the lady who first took my order came back only 3 times. A young lady also came by to take an order. A young lad cleaned up the plates.   This very same young lad filled up the water of the table across from us one table down and could not bring his eyes to see that our table also had two cups of empty water. After walking past as 3 times without doing anything, I had to bring up myself to tell him to refill the water. A customer shouldn't have to ask. That was supposed to be automatic. Well, maybe if the restaurant didn't put that many msg in, we wouldn't gulp down our water and waited for over 15 minutes afterward without anyone filling them up.   Although, I have to give one star more because they give a lot of food per plate. This may be bad for some people because they want to try more dishes than sticking up with the same old love.

e9_9tftfOITrnIHhr1IjEg.text: Love their Yang nyum galbi!!!  All the sides you can order for your kids such as corn cheese, japchae, vegetable tempura!  Definitely number one place for Korean BBQ in town

0Xrn2dknDWGzlu_cYA6PXQ.text: I am giving 4 stars for the food only! The meats and side dishes are always good. I really like that they have the King Oyster mushrooms with the veggies. Most of the other korean bbq joints in Arizona just serve you regular white mushrooms. I love to get chadol baegi, steamed egg and the soon dobu soup at least.   If i had to rate the restaurant on service or comfort, I would give less stars. The staff is not rude, it's just that food items were forgotten every single time that we have gone and we have had to ask for items several times. The booths are really small. I am a petite person and I think the seating is a little tight. There also doesn't seem to be group seating. 4 small people can fit in a booth.

photos.caption: Photo of Manna BBQ - Mesa, AZ, United States. Steamed egg, chadol baegi, mushrooms. The glass noodles were good too.

wxww6KgOrQZr2QO717NVpQ.text: Yeah, this place pretty much rocks.  I hadn't had Korean BBQ in about two decades, but was still extolling it to the wife.  When the time came for lunch today, I said to myself, "Hey, howabout Korean?"  A bit of a search on Yelp yielded Manna.  The cook-it-yourself model looked perfect.  It was.  You pick from an A or B selection at two slightly different prices per plate, and then it's all-you-can-eat pigout time for two hours.  You get a variety of different things to stick on the table grill--beefs, porks, chickens, and seafoods, marinated (or not) in specific sauces.  I wasn't too thrilled with the octopus (literally 4-5 inch whole octopi).  The texture was not my thing, but that's not Manna's fault.  The beef was thin and like paper, but quite tasty.  I loved the chicken bulgogi and the pork.  I also got glass noodles and some rice.  Extra tasty, left with a full stomach.  If the pieces are large, you can cut the servings with food scissors.  Great, attentive service.  If you're looking for Manna from Heaven Korean-style, or maybe even Gangham-style, come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Manna BBQ - Mesa, AZ, United States. More please.

3lFIdhhOJvZCo2r4kFB8wg.text: Would you go somewhere you have to make your own food? Your knee jerk reaction may be, heck NO, but alas, what if it were Korean BBQ? Have you never tried this type of amazing food? Don't be intimidated, there are many happy and willing helpers at the restaurant that can show you the way to AYCE bliss. Ok, now it's time.for the meat sweats   This place is fantastic. I miss thier old menu, it seems they consolidated so that they have only one menu (rather than an A&B option),however there is still a plethora of options. My fave options are BEEF....brisket, tongue and the king among the beef choices, BELLY (think uncured bacon but BEEF, the fat ratio is outta control so there is so much flavor. Not to be forgotten are all the amazing appetizers, dishes and bachan (yummy kimchi and other small bites of flavorful often fermented foods), pork, chicken and seafood options. They also have marinated meats were are tasty, but I avoid sugar so I don't get them as often. My favorite is bulgogi and probably a good one to try if you've never had Korean food before. I always ask for sliced jalepenos and garlic as well to have with my meat. There is a grill mid table and a pull down vent, I don't wanna go into too much detail with this because they WILL help  it is well worth the price for the selection and experience.

Ex1K3tM-iFd_RITXDUmJVQ.text: They updated their appetizer portion of their menu along with another set of menu that is not all you can eat.. I believe it's 11.99 a person but each person can pick two appetizers along with two types of meat.. or you can you just stick with ur lunch ayce price of 17.99 during lunch hours or 24.99 during dinner.. but they have added cheesy corn along with Korean chicken wings and dumplings I believe with other many options they have like steamed egg and etc..

gjptTAaB1tChg98GRnNQRg.text: I don't understand why the service sucks today. No one came back to see how my friend and I were doing. The food is great and I'd give it five stars but not happy right now. It wasn't even that busy for a memorial day..  I've always been coming here whether they are busy or not but for the first time, I didn't like the service. We got seated and received our food after we ordered and that is about all there was. Our waitress passed by us as if we weren't even there. She checked other tables to see how they were doing. Another waitress came by and handed us pot stickers but we didn't even order that. I even made eye contact but bruh come on!  I waved here and there but they just hurried walking. Like bruh. After about a good 45 mins, the grill was burning with no more food on it and another waitress came by to check how we're doing since finally she noticed the thing was burning and after telling her we didn't order the pot stickers, she looked confused and grabbed it. I asked her for the check which never came until 15 mins after, this waiter asked if we needed more water but honestly we just wanted to leave and check please.  My friend jokingly said "Is it because I'm black? No one is coming at our table. Look around girl, I'm the only black woman in here." And I said don't say that. Lol she said she'd rather go to Gen KBBQ in Tempe since we were served better there and never to take her here again.  I'd come back another day till I crave for kbbq again  1 star for service and 5 stars for the food.. sheesh!

7qTIqSju7BgsNuEdtaHK7A.text: I love this place! The food is amazing (when we don't burn it by accident) LOL, and I love all their options.

photos.caption: Photo of Manna BBQ - Mesa, AZ, United States. We ordered the pork belly, chicken and bulgogi.

qc2g2xHKPyqaWmxe37xbhw.text: Wonderful Korean bbq experience here on a Saturday night. We beat the crowd by coming around 6:30pm. There was no wait until around 7:45pm!  The selection of meats is incredible here. We stuck with our favorites of brisket, pork belly, spicy pork belly, and LA Galbi.  The selection of side dishes is pretty great as well. There were marinated beansprouts, marinated cucumbers, fish cake, kimchi, marinated radish, and mashed potatoes. I love eating a bite of radish with a bite of meat.  I will definitely be returning to Manna for my Korean bbq desires! Friendly staff and fresh meats makes a happy meal.

RDEqxGylAyiJm6dxXh1rXg.text: Its bbq time! Came here with a group of 6 for dinner for my sister's bday. It has the typical all you can eat option which was great. They do take reservations. But because it was busy we did have to ask for some items or a drink multiple times before it would get to our tables.  Overall no major issues. Solid choice for bbq.

gDagwlNeVSVlKFOVOZzHxg.text: Our first time here and it is wonderful!  The food is delicious- get the premium!  As a meat lover of the highest order I felt like I was in heaven.  And our server Cameron was fantastic; always at our side with the next serving.  We WILL be back.

evrQPvoK8PgOjuSOfczTSQ.text: Hands down our favorite place for AYCE BBQ in Phoenix! Everything from the food and service was good. I loved that we didn't have to wait forever to get seated like other BBQ places. The quality of meat was really good and flavorful. Good selection of side dishes and I especially loved the steam eggs! The servers are attentive and helpful and we never had to wait long for the food. They also have a call button that you can use if you need your server to come to your table. That definitely reminds me of the restaurants in LA. We really enjoyed our food and definitely be coming back !

ykQ5gCL9SsqVYcHtc9cZBA.text: Food are pretty decent for the price. We got the $21.99 portion, and kids under 5 can eat for free. Meat portions and meal selections were good and were marinated on point. However, service can't be considered top notch since we literally had to flag the servers for extra things here and there. It was so confused because our first waitress completely disappeared after take our first order, and left it to the other colleagues to take care of our table for the rest of the night. Grills were changed constantly, but no water refilled or food refilled.   We are still going back, just because of the food. I hope that service could be improved better.

5a6Zi_nT2gdNElFRMREOVA.text: The service at this location is excellent. I really enjoy how it's a team effort (anyone on the staff will help you). The food is good too, and very fresh. By far one of the better, more reasonably priced Korean BBQ places in town.

yioUGL10tc0VSOyPVDnGwQ.text: The food is soo sooo delicious!!  The service is also so great. Our waitress was so nice and attentive!  Everything is so authentic here. The taste, the atmosphere... I highly recommend stoping here

Vr1tdgNm-J7OJkCJ6SXYgQ.text: Real deal Holyfield, this place is awesome!  After experiencing AYCE at this place, it's going to be truly hard to go back to other places.  I love Korean BBQ, one of the biggest drawbacks is generally it's pretty expensive.  My wife and I would go and easily drop 100.00 if not more, and we don't even drink.  So I like places like Hoodori, ChoDang, Sizzle, and Ohya but I always spend a lot at those places and sometimes walk away not full.  Well after experiencing Manna BBQ I found it a much better experience and as far as the quality, it was right up there with those places.  For 28.99 a person, it's a heck of a deal.  So we ventured here on a Tuesday night, they were pretty busy and after reading the reviews, they get pretty packed on the weekends as well.  I came here with my wife and my brother and his girl.  We ordered variety of different meats, soups, and sides.  Everything was right on and delicious.  We ordered tons of food and the wait staff was extremely nice and helpful.  Overall, one heck of a dining experience.  I think this was one of the better meals I've had in a long time.  I am very impressed and would highly recommend this place to anybody.

pBW6cCKi3ymQb2BoEwdHVA.text: Manna is my favorite Korean BBQ spot now, I don't go to Gen that often since their opening. I usually go with the AYCE plan with premium meats since the quality and meat varieties are so much better than the regular one.   Food: They gave you beef tongues generously, unlike Gen only gave us a few slides every order. The meats are really fresh and marbling.   Service: Good. We've been here for a few times and all of the servers were extremely nice, especially a Korean lady who are super helpful and nice.  Con: they don't offer drinks with refill. That's probably the only con I could think of.  Price: a little pricer that other places but I think it worths.

Y2F79OH-_vcMKh0BJVj19w.text: We have explored many different Korean AYCE restaurants and Korean restaurants in Phoenix. Last night we visited Manna with our friends. The food was great! They give you rice which Sizzle in North Scottsdale doesn't. They make you pay extra!   Can't wait to come back with more friends and family!

YU87H1qpvDcNzvr3sP-4gA.text: (In 'mother dearest' fashion) noo rice papersssss! This was one of two biggest fails for me...this, and the onion salad. The latter is more forgivable since most kbbq places don't have it but given that the one place that does is its cali locations, it's hard not to compare. The place was nice, as clean as a kbbq joint can be and felt familiar. We'd been hankering for ayce kbbq and were excited when we heard gen was opening up, but even more excited when we realized there was a manna location opening up much closer. The staff were friendly, the food was good but their lack of rice paper and the realization they did not have the onion salad was so heartbreaking... im being dramatic. It's good, it's cheaper than gen, and normally not as busy. You don't get all the same items but you pay for what you get, and it'll satiate our needs until our trips back  to cali to the infallable 9.99 joints we're used to.

TS3QJhY_mtl5j4a0NFpgcw.text: Great place to visit with friends! Fun and yum vsuper veriety of meats! Soooooooo goooooood!

iOygCOVMYO-XIcqbIrd2nQ.text: Every time I went to CA I had to make a trip to AYCE KBBQ, so I'm pleased that KBBQ has made it's way to the valley.  In the valley, I've had Gen and Gangnam.  I've found Manna has better meats than both.  Gen has better options in terms of off-grill items (like KFC and Gyoza) but I'd still choose Manna just for the quality of meats.  Price is fair for AYCE Korean BBQ and about what the average cost is in CA.  For service, at first, I thought it was lacking, but I started using the call button that's on each table.  Once I did that, service was superb.  I've noticed as of late service has been more proactive and much better.  Since coming here, I stopped going and trying other KBBQ places in the valley with the exception of going to Gen one more time.  However, that experience at Gen was definitely lacking and they've gone downhill since they first opened.  I look forward to my monthly visit to Manna every first of the month.  I would go more often, but I got to keep my belly size in check :).

_o4SejmszG1njL2ZeiFPZQ.text: This place is the best! We got there early to avoid any waiting. The quality of meat was good for AYCE and the portions and cuts were way better then GEN. The service was wonderful and friendly. The only thing was that the table was a little dirty when we sat down, but I talked with the server and they cleaned it right up. Highly recommended! I use to live in LA so I compare most Korean BBQ places to LA. This place is far the best so far.

kwP03DlBsNu3dIxFZMRIaA.text: Really cool restaurant! You grill your own meat in the middle of the table with really good sauce and sides. Korean BBQ.

iClnS9HVJ2EVeGE2wMyvpw.text: Good Korean BBQ!  The Galbi was thick.  The Bulgogi wasn't shredded, it was thin sheets of beef like it should be.  The tofu soup was delicious and spicy!  Next time we are here from SoCal this will be our spot to eat!  One of the best AYCE places we have had!  Great job!

G0Q04SL6OXYIDMMydpidXA.text: Great selection of food to put on the grill! Be ready to eat non stop. We always get the more expensive option as it allows us to enjoy the seafood dishes. The baby octopus may look scary but it's really tasty. The shrimp is always a must for us. The sparerib is a highlight as well.

WL1S9cQif1rIH-Uw4TwMxQ.text: I've been to many Korean barbecues (Yakinikus) so I have some experience in rating these types of restaurants. Three things I like to rate restaurants on are service and hospitality, quality of food, and pricing. Before I start my review, I'd like to inform you that this is an "all you can eat" yakiniku. You have two hours to eat whatever you order on their menu, so pace yourself and don't over order! You will be charged for leftovers!   First off, hospitality and service. Despite being absolutely busy the night I went, the waiters/waitresses were always prompt on tending to my requests. They have a button on the side of the table which calls a waiter or waitress over, and the response time was never more than a minute. The waiters and waitresses (Yakinikus don't function like traditional restaurants, you will be seeing more than one waiter/waitress while dining) were always courteous and addressed all my needs quickly. Excellent customer service and hospitality.  Second point. Food. The food was great. The restaurant is located right next to an Asian market, which is where I imagine they source all their meats and spices. Everything seemed authentic and tasted delicious. The bulgogi and kalbi were well marinated, I'd highly recommend you order these two items (they're a staple in Korean cuisine). The sides are also delicious and free, so don't hesitate to order more sides! Food was definitely a five out of five.  Now, for pricing. As you can expect out of an all you can eat restaurant, you pay a one time fee. I am quite embarrassed to say I don't remember how much I paid for my dinner (I had 6 family members that night), but I believe it came out to about $22 per person for dinner pricing, which is pretty damn good! Just make sure you eat three orders worth of meat per person if you want to get value out of your meal (that is if you don't mind looking like a glutton).   Overall, would highly recommend this restaurant! Good food, good pricing, and great service!

YeOFf4kKK2E3w4icQtlTfA.text: This place was the first korean bar-b-que I have ever been to. AWESOME. Just let them know if your new to this they will assist. Food was so dang good I loved it. Oh yeah!

T5Pd5QkSRTwgBmqmFZkUnA.text: Sooooo amazing!!! The meat is so good, and fresh! They are very generous when it comes to giving out meat! It's not that paper thin slice, it's legit! They servers are all so very nice and they don't rush you. They have two different menu sizes to choose from. The food is very worth the price. Steamed egg is very good as well. Wish they had rice paper!!!!!

DBDd02dPq3UQVjOWDmIAKg.text: Good value will eat here again due to high quality service and food. Scarlett was a great hostess.

74s4AqH2sHXkBiAA0AexRQ.text: One of the top KBBQ spots in Phoenix for sure. We have been to almost every single one across the valley, and we keep coming back to Manna here in Mesa.   The service is outstanding, the meat quality is great, the banchan is delicious! Try to get here early as it does fill up fast, but the wait is definitely worth it.   It's always fun to try some of the different meats they have, the Octopus was pretty tasty, and also the small intestine!   The servers are very friendly and accommodating if you need any refills, extra sides, etc.   Definitely worth checking out!

BayRknLimIugx7nKyCOKrg.text: Okay so I see a lot of reviews comparing this place to Gen.... well I like this place way better then Gen in Az. Definitely will be back Goutsal! Their meats had tons of flavor from the Bugolgi to Galbi. Also had the tofu stew. Staff was friendly very clean restaurant and yes I know it's new. It was worth every penny.

H4Lcp8OAUB5H2fUaj4pPeg.text: Yet again we had terrible service. I feel this time it was due to some slight racism. The server was female, she took and brought our first order. After that it's like she was completely ignoring us. He table behind and across from us were getting great service and she stopped by there tables several times.  She even passed by and looked straight at me several times. Every time I pressed the call button, it was always someone else who came by. Chatted with the owner and learned that he started manna bbq in San Diego and has several restaurants in California, Arizona, and soon Texas. Manna has good meat quality (although brisket was sliced too thick), the best soups that come with the meal, and second best side dishes of the three - best was Gangnam.  It has the highest drink prices but lowest meal prices.  The marinades are stronger here, both sweeter and spicier.  I think you can't really go wrong with all these places and we enjoyed our meal here and will return.

jZkF3ATp7Orb643LvmxFOA.text: I love this place! After being disappointed with all of the AYCE Kbbq places around the valley this place is a gem. It's hard to find descent Korean BBQ places in Arizona especially from being spoiled by the plethora of choices while traveling in California. When this place opened I was skeptical but I was pleasantly surprised. My biggest compliment would probably be the quality of their meat. There are many KBBQ places that may offer more of a selection of meats but their quality is nowhere near this place. They have all the essentials (Bulgogi, Brisket, Pork Belly, etc.) and their banchan selection is tasty as well. You can choose from two different AYCE options and the pricing is great for the quality and amount of food. So far I would say this place is one of the best in the area. I would recommend!

We did order the shrimp and would probably not order again just because it was a lot of working peeling them when they're hot and slippery and not a lot of reward. But overall would go back again and again!

B58MxX1-EldlKlYOqOSEhg.text: Manna BBQ....sigh  I secretly kinda hope that this place doesn't get too LIT, cuz I love this place and don't want to fight the lines or for the server's attention like other popular KBBQ places.   I'm pretty sure y'all already know the whole thang with KBBQs by now, so imma just point out the things that make this place stand out.   Portion size - they. are. HUGE. Like if GEN brings one order of let's say beef belly, then the same one order here would be like two to three times the GEN's portion size. I LOVE that. I means it's gonna be AYCE already, no need to be stingy right? Manna BBQ, well at least currently, are doing portion sizes right   Price - kind of the same deal as other place. I think Mon - Thurs for lunch it's .. 17.99? That's pretty nice :) Fri-Sun is just always dinner prices.   Meat - okay y'all, I have always been a brisket kind of guy. But you know how sometimes the brisket can be just  but sometimes it's like "eh" and a bit dry? So here's the deal, get the BEEF BELLY. it's straight .com  it's like FATTY and soft and chewy and my goodness. Yea trust me you won't go wrong.   I also tried the premium menu a couple times, and they have this like "jumoolok" or something, a rib fillet and that meats marbling is quite ridiculous. So soft and tender.   I'm always a fan of the pork cheek, it's also on point here, but so is their pork belly. Nice and thick slices, also a fav.   Want something marinated? get the LA something galbi or bulgogi, but I'm more a non marinated type of guy.   Long story short : the KBBQ joint that has taken over GEN's number one spot for me

Photo of Manna BBQ - Mesa, AZ, United States. STACKS ON  STACKS
Photo of Manna BBQ - Mesa, AZ, United States. Oh man. That MARBLING

rySxom5Y9Js0fgU4h44Apw.text: Seriously one of the best Korean BBQ's in the area!  I love Manna because there isn't much of a wait, they offer larger tables in a private room if you have a large party and all the meat was top quality.   We went here for my friends birthday with a party of 7. We were seated within minutes and the service was attentive. The whole table was adorned with sides and accompaniments while we waited to choose. They offer Soju though you need to check what flavors they offer. If you are eating as a group, make sure you all choose the same meat selection as they whole table has to be the same.  The beef was great quality and they let us order enough meat for one for each person. The pork belly was delicious, falvorful and the best part, you get to cook it yourself!!! You get to order as much meat as you want for 2 hours. Also they have steamed egg which was perfect and rice that you can order with your other choices.   One of the neat features is each station has a fan you can pull down to help pull up the smoke and heat. The price was decent, we spent $21 a person and although it was the cheaper option, the meat wasn't poor quality.  Tons of free parking in the area and they have other local businesses nearby such as a bakery, korean beauty and boba. So check it out and make it a fun day.

kXF85yT4g98s_hNF3ZaNxQ.text: Came here for lunch since I live in Glendale, it was really excited to me after found another All you can eat KBBQ.   Food: I love the food here, really fresh and well seasoned. Overall, I have no complaints for this.  Cost: They have 2 kind of AYCE. I believe is $23.99 and $28.99 for the upgrade. With me, I think it's a little high since in GEN, they have more food but only $24.99  Service: This is the reason why I gave them 2 stars. We being served by an old Korean lady, and whenever we want to order more food, she gave us a look that we are BEGGING for food, which is make me really upset since we have to pay a lot for our lunch   Hopefully that they would be more better in service since I really love the food here.

Va8R28ir3oIJlPF_rXo6Ag.text: Food was good but not good enough to have to deal with horrible service! Grumpy servers that never smile. I'll pass.

4fw-RITnsVjPnKae7SdyhQ.text: Tried gen a few months ago.  Manna was easier to get in . We did make resbut it was not necessary.  Prices were cheaper  than gen . It was not as smokey.  Ventilation  was much better. Service was  much better. They brought out food promptly.  There was no extra charge for rice and the place was relatively quiet.  I was happy with the meats

YDkGI9ua0yz_2h-70HgCJw.text: We've gone there 5 times the past month. BEST KOREAN BBQ IN TOWN! It feels authentic and the marinated for the meats are so delicious! Highly recommend the chicken.

eRNqOMEePHIEq44A5jilZA.text: Great food! It may seem weird to have to cook your own food, but it's actually fun. We really enjoyed ourselves. If you have a large group, you may want to reserve a table. Our group of 7 had to wait a long time. Still worth it though.

kZjCCizOdEbd5Kbo46IG-g.text: Came here around 8pm with my boyfriend and they were saying last call would be at 9pm so we put in many ordered before 9pm. We did the $21.99 AYCE option which has our essentials when it comes to KBBQ: brisket, Kalbi, pork belly, octopus, bulgolgi, steamed egg and tofu stew versus $27.99 for the premium stuff. I even liked all the sides: raddish strips, raddish slices, kimchee, cucumbers, fish cakes, potatoes and salads. I left full and really likes the salt dip with my briskets. Would definitely return. Service is fast and friendly - with a call button at your table if you need immediate assistance. Plentiful parking in the plaza lot too.

nw1nOLPVni3VcKm6rMz2mw.text: Quite possibly one of the best Korean BBQ places I've been to in Arizona. First off the place was super clean and the music ambiance was more casual than the hipster look. I went to lunch with my wife and it was a great experience. The service was super friendly as well. The addition of the movable vent hoods and call button made for less smoke and easy service calls for more meat.   The meat itself was great: good cuts of meat with good marbleization. The marinated bulgogi was delicious as well. One of the huge pluses too was the meat was fresh and came out rolled (instead of the lukewarm meat I've been served before). This makes for unraveling and grilling a lot easier.   Overall, I'd definitely be coming back to this place. Maybe dinner though since I can try even more types of meat.

Ul4KhzS9ryycgOMYLIG54A.text: This place was pretty good. We are very familiar with Korean BBQ so we have some good experience to compare to. This place is an all-you-can-eat Korean BBQ restaurant. They have 2 different tiers you can order. We went with the cheaper one because we didn't think the other meats offered in the more expensive one was worth the price difference. That and we didn't really care for the other meats. The cheaper one has more than enough choices for a great experience.   The staff was friendly. The owner came and talked to us and gave us suggestions of which meats to order. He even gave us hints to the more expensive meats on the menu, and let us know that the cheaper meats make him more money. Although the cheaper meats are very good, he said to try to fill our bellies with the more expensive ones! It was very honest and kind of him.   The wait staff seemed a little busy but they did an acceptable job. There is a button on the wall you can push to summon them, so that is pretty nice. The restaurant is pretty crowded in the sense that there is not a lot of space to walk around. The tables are close together and the paths of travel tend to get congested.   The woman's restroom is a bit wacky. One of the toilet stalls are so small, there is no way you can sit and use it. It seems that the restrooms were retrofitted to an existing space. It's definitely not an acceptable size, but there is another toilet next to it that is big enough. I just thought it was funny.   Overall, this is one of the best in the PHX area. I haven't tried Gen BBQ yet, but I have heard this place gives it a run for its money.

aDywIMS5ED2ShpcaenAJvA.text: Really expensive, terrible service. Go to a Brazilian bbq for good ayce that's already cooked.

vrOxQcORaFok9Tgdg_wbTA.text: This is real deal, legit Korean BBQ! All you can eat, yakiniku style. Can't go wrong. All the meats were pretty tasty, and with a pretty wide selection.  Not to mention the service. The entire staff, including Alex & Sharron was very helpful, and attentive. We'll definitely be back. Just be sure to come hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Manna BBQ - Mesa, AZ, United States. Boneless short ribs
Photo of Manna BBQ - Mesa, AZ, United States. Kalbi
Photo of Manna BBQ - Mesa, AZ, United States. Pork Jowl &amp; Baby Octopus

DgVliXiVO7TCnVgG3Ogpcw.text: When in Mesa, you've got to hit up some of the best Asian restaurants in the city.   We had just walked for about 3 hours, fueled mainly on trail mix, jerky, and Cheetos (okay, so the Cheetos were all me). So we weren't going to mess around when we got in here. Premium All You Can Eat was the way to go. And we certainly ate all we could, and then dessert on top of that.   I was lucky enough to have two grill masters as dining companions this Sunday evening, so my friend and I sat back and watched the many plates of ordered meat get cooked in front of us: bulgogi, pork jowl, shrimp, rib eye, spicy samgyup sal, more bulgogi... we had more, but hell if I can remember it.   The truth is, you don't need to be a grilling pro for this. It's so simple. Just toss your meat on there and flip. The servers come by often enough to check up on you. There's also a button on the wall for you to press if you're in desperate need of more bulgogi. The servers came by quite often to our table to turn up our fan and change out our hot plate. We had a great time. And all our food was so flavorful and delicious. I think the only thing we weren't completely sold on were the shrimp. Those got messy, removing the veins and shells.    For sides, we requested bowls of rice, japchae (glass noodles), and soon dubu (tofu stew). Nothing to write home about with these, but they were just fine for sides. The tofu stew had a nice spice to it and had maybe oysters in it? Not bad.   There's a time limit of 2 hours, and at about 1.5 hours, we were slowing down. After finishing off the last of what meat was left on the plates (can't let that go to waste... oof), we ordered two coffee ice cream macarons and one vanilla. The perfect ending.

4Pmjp953Heyczr-7_xay-A.text: My friend and I did the AYCE deal for dinner. Our server Justin was really nice and kept checking on us to get whatever we needed. They play really cool music here and the staff is relatively young. The inside has traditional Korean elements but it's still contemporary. I enjoyed the food but it didn't WOW me. I like the location since it's right next to Asians Market. Will come back if I'm ever in the Mesa area!

photos.caption: Photo of Manna BBQ - Mesa, AZ, United States

0MsvPbQadTI-oo6hd-noFw.text: We tried the cheaper $21.99 all you can eat option and I thought it was an excellent value! We tried the bulgogi, galbi, and other types of meats that I don't remember the Korean names for. I liked that the meat was marinated, not just plain like at some other Korean places.  The japchae glass noodles were delicious too. There was nothing I tried that I didn't enjoy. The only thing I wish is that they refilled our sides and maybe had squid on the menu. I didn't try the tofu stew but my friend said it was good.  We came on a Sunday at noon and there was no wait! I would definitely come back again some time.

pqL3hVrP_KFB54K6GKh6rA.text: I have tried this place multiple times in California, so I kind of expect the same from here. This is an AYCE (All You Can EAT) KBBQ restaurant where you're able to choose A1 or A2 of your selections. This includes some side dishes and salad which are refillable with your meal. The meat quality is great and the service as well. This place is a bit smaller than other location in California, but this will do!

TRrlon2zPUwzhCtX4zbY6g.text: First experience was last night with my friend and her son.  We were told there was a long wait we ended up being sat really quickly and getting our drink orders taken immediately.   Today, I come here with my boyfriend to eat.. We walk in Get sat,  We wait for 15, it shouldn't take that long for us to have someone come by and Greet us, give us drinks or even take our drink order.  No Ban Chan set up around,  I press the call button, no one shows up to ask if we need something... They turn off the alert and ignore us.   We wait a few minutes longer.  I get up and go I ask to speak to the Manager,  She comes to me, doesn't offer an Apology, no explanation to why we aren't getting any service.   It was very upsetting cause last night it was super busy, today it was not busy at all, there were a lot of empty tables.   Please do not support this type of business.  I love korean food, lived in Korea for a long time I am not brand new to the culture.   I'm very upset about how these people behaved.  Especially the manager who decided to Do nothing about it.   You want a better experience go to GEN ! Tempe market place.  Quality of food is much better at GEN  The marinades and Sauces are delicious.  Manna Is a terrible excuse for Korean food.

ebjPBaFbGGICfC7XbN2yKQ.text: Ever since Gens Korean BBQ came out there have been uproar of other Korean BBQ places here in AZ. However this Korean BBQ place is one of my least places to go to because the service was not good and the meat was okay. The waitress barely came around at the table when we needed more meat and more side dishes. She also kept adjusting our heat to cook the meat which was very annoying. The meat was very chewy and not very good.  I do not recommend coming here if you want to try Korean BBQ for the first time.

A77BPaRfwDCU5KlkQ39paw.text: Customer Service here is outstanding everyone there worked as a team. We were checked up and asked if we needed anything not from just our assigned waitress. Also, the grill was changed out when needed no need to ask. They are really attentive.   The food quality is greater than GEN for sure. We did the A1 and got Rib Eye Steak, Galbi, short rib filet, pork belly, beef belly, brisket, steam egg, tofu soup, japchae glass noodles.   It was my first time here and this place exceeded our expectations. This will be my go to spot from now on if I'm ever craving KBBQ.

8jPwUUXreDo2OFl13K62Sg.text: Service was exceptional and my server Song did a really good job at making sure I had everything I needed. Would definitely checking this place out!

iia09oJdnnWr4htvQvqtWw.text: Staff are very nice people, but honestly the food is aiiiight. When they first opened, the quality of the brisket and pork belly were great. k13oIuq7HsoYZl1-okPVuw.text: My wife surprised me with dinner here. This is the first time that we have eaten at an 'All You Can Eat' Korean restaurant. ag8Lko4X-2qK3hn6ovDXPg.text: Expensive, little options for vegetarians or fish eaters. We ordered the lunch one menu ,all people have to order the same pre-fixe menu. 7QE42Wg1Ceqcxu1jHec5qQ.text: Absolutely love this place. Went here for my birthday back in January and was blown away by the quality of meat served.
